alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 6:54PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTY THROUGH 730 PM MDT... At 653 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking light rain showers with strong outflow boundaries near Roswell. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Dexter, Bottomless Lakes State Park, and Midway. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 94 and 104. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 166. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong outflow winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
